column2: Before you had your new baby, did you ever have a baby by cesarean delivery or c-section (when a doctor cuts through the mother?s belly to bring out the baby)?
How was your new baby delivered?
column17: Vaginally (if yes, then skip to question 5)

column2: Which statement best describes whose idea it was for you to have a cesarean delivery (c-section)? Check ONE answer
column17: My health care provider recommended a cesarean delivery before I went into labor
column18: My health care provider recommended a cesarean delivery while I was in labor
column19: I asked for the cesarean delivery

column2: What was the reason that your new baby was born by cesarean delivery (c-section)? Check ALL that apply
column17: I had a previous cesarean delivery (c-section)
column18: My baby was in the wrong position (such as breech)
column19: I was past my due date
column20: My health care provider worried that my baby was too big
column21: I had a medical condition that made labor dangerous for me (such as heart condition, physical disability)
column22: I had a complication in my pregnancy (such as preeclampsia, placental problems, infection, preterm labor)
column23: My health care provider tried to induce my labor, but it didn?t work
column25: The fetal monitor showed that my baby was having problems before or during labor (fetal distress)
column26: I wanted to schedule my delivery
column27: I didn?t want to have my baby vaginally

column2: What was the reason that your new baby was born by cesarean delivery (c-section)? Check ALL that apply
Did your doctor, nurse, or other health care worker try to induce your labor (start your contractions using medicine)?
Why did your doctor, nurse, or other health care worker try to induce your labor (start your contractions using medicine)? Check ALL that apply
column17: My water broke and there was a fear of infection
column18: I was past my due date
column19: My health care provider worried about the size of the baby
column20: My baby was not doing well and needed to be born
column21: I had a complication in my pregnancy (such as low amniotic fluid or preeclampsia)
column22: Labor stopped or was not progressing
column23: I wanted to schedule my delivery
column24: I wanted to give birth with a specific health care provider
